intro: Stigmaphyllon chiapense, commonly known as the Chiapas stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
